dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.enterprise.wf.wspec.WorkSpecification
dataStructure.description:
WorkSpecification describes the characteristics of a type of (manual) work. The characteristic/characteristic value pattern may be applied for WorkSpecification (and work as an instance). For example, WorkSpecification could be Assembly of server blade in a shelf .

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: WorkSpecification

child.name: isAppointmentRequired
child.description:
Specifies if this kind of work requires an appointment with the customer/owner to be performed at their location

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: isAppointmentRequired

child.name: lifeCycleStatus
child.description:
Status of the Work Specification, such as planned, approved, active, inactive

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: lifeCycleStatus

child.name: standardDuration
child.description:
Standard duration of time, under normal condition and assumptions, that the work can take to be completed

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: standardDuration

child.name: standardCapacityRequired
child.description:
Standard workforce capacity (man hour, man day) under normal condition and assumptions that the work requires to be completed

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: standardCapacityRequired

child.name: skillSpecification

This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association WorkRequiresSkill

This association end is optional
child.label: skillSpecification
